intro: Ipomoea koloaensis, commonly known as the Koloa morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of violet and blue. The plant typically grows as a vine, with heart-shaped leaves and a rapid growth habit. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the unique environmental conditions of Hawaii. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
